colorMap
Class ColorMap

java.lang.Object
  colorMap.ColorMap

public class ColorMap
extends java.lang.Object

A class which performs mapping from values to colors. There are two modes of color mapping: continuous and discrete. In continuous mode, the color map is defined by a set of color-value pairs, whose values are between 0 and 1. Input values are mapped to colors by performing linear interpolation between the colors of the two color-value pairs whose values are closest to the input value. In discrete mode, the color map is defined by an array of colors. Input values are integers which are mapped to colors by looking up the color in the array at the index of the input value.

Author:
Curran Kelleher

colorNodes

public java.util.List<ColorNode> colorNodes
The list of color-value pairs which define this color map.

Constructor Detail

ColorMap

public ColorMap(java.awt.Color[] colors)
Construct a discrete ColorMap with the specified Colors. When this constructor is used, getColor(int discreteValue) should be used to retrieve colors, not getColor(double value)

Parameters:
colors - the colors which will comprise this color map initially.

Construct a continuous ColorMap with the specified ColorNodes

Parameters:
colorNodes - the color nodes which will comprise this color map initially

Method Detail

setDiscreteColors

public void setDiscreteColors(java.awt.Color[] colors)
Construct a discrete ColorMap with the specified Colors

Parameters:
colors - the new array of colors for this discrete color map

alignDiscreteNodes

public void alignDiscreteNodes()
Resets the values of the color nodes to reflect their discrete positions

calculateColors

public void calculateColors()
Populates the color array based on the current color nodes

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(int discreteValue)
Gets the Color corresponding to the specified discrete value in this color map. This method will only function properly when the constructor ColorMap(Color[] colors) is used.

Parameters:
discreteValue - the integer value for which this method will return the corresponding Color. If this value is less than 0 or greater than the number of colors in this color map (n), the color corresponding to 0 or n (respectively) will be returned.
Returns:
the Color corresponding to the specified value. (No new Color object is allocated, a Color object from a pre-calculated array is returned. see getColorArray())

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor(double value)
Gets the Color corresponding to the specified value in this color map.

Parameters:
value - the value between 0 and 1 for which this method will return the corresponding Color. If this value is less than 0 or greater than 1, 0 or 1 (respectively) will be used instead.
Returns:
the Color corresponding to the specified value. (No new Color object is allocated, a Color object from a pre-calculated array is returned. see getColorArray())

getColorArray

public java.awt.Color[] getColorArray()
Returns the precomputed array of Color objects which represent this color map.

paintOnThis

public void paintOnThis(java.awt.Graphics g,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int width,
                        int height)
Draws this color map horizontally (leftmost = 0, rightmost = 1) in a rectangle with the specified x, y, width, and height.

Parameters:
g - the Graphics on which to draw the color map rectangle
x - the x pixel coordinate of the rectangle
y - the y pixel coordinate of the rectangle
width - the width of the rectangle
height - the height of the rectangle

getColorNodes

public java.util.List<ColorNode> getColorNodes()
Gets the color nodes that comprise this color map.

getDefaultContinuousColorMap

public static ColorMap getDefaultContinuousColorMap()
Generates the default continuous color map.

Returns:
a newly allocated ColorMap object with default settings

getDefaultDiscreteColorMap

public static ColorMap getDefaultDiscreteColorMap()
Generates the default discrete color map.

Returns:
a newly allocated discrete ColorMap object with default settings

isDiscrete

public boolean isDiscrete()
Returns:
True when this color map is discrete, that is, when the constructor ColorMap(Color[] colors) is used. Returns false if this color map is continuous.
